intro: Adelia oaxacana, commonly known as the Oaxacan adelia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Oaxaca, Mexico. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its showy, pentagonal flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and elevations between 1,500 and 3,000 meters. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and somewhat woody. Adelia oaxacana is adapted to the arid and semi-arid climate of its native habitat, with a dormant period during the dry season.
